#Text=3.
#Text=The Proposed Method
#Text=The ensemble method integrates various fault classification methods to improve the fault classification capability .
#Text=A basic ensemble method includes the selection of base classifiers and the determination of fusion strategies .

#Text=In this study , six basic classifiers were selected : linear discriminant analysis ( LDA ) , K-nearest neighbor ( KNN ) , Bayesian classifier ( BN ) , random forest ( RF ) , support vector machine ( SVM ) and the BP neural network ( BP ) .
#Text=Decision fusion is achieved by the CW and improved voting methods .
#Text=The specific framework of our proposed fusion system is shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=.
#Text=3.1. Selection of Base Classifiers
#Text=Considering the requirement of diversity for the ensemble classification system , we selected six representative classifiers from the supervised category .
#Text=Among them , LDA is a linear classifier , which is suitable for the classification of linear separable problems .
#Text=KNN is a simple classifier , which determines the classification result by comparing the distance between the sample to be classified and all training samples .
#Text=BN is one of the commonly used classifiers .
#Text=It has an advantage in terms of classification speed and is suitable for applications with small-scale samples and missing values .
#Text=RF is an integrated classifier based on the decision tree and has the advantage of a low computation cost .
#Text=It can deal with high-dimensional samples and sample imbalance .
#Text=The typical advantage of SVM is that it can use small samples and is also good for nonlinear problems .
#Text=The BP neural network is a multi-layer feed-forward neural network with error backpropagation , which is advantageous for dealing with nonlinear problems .
#Text=3.2. Classifier Performance Evaluation
#Text=To measure the classification performance , four evaluation indicators were used : ( 21 ) ( 22 ) ( 23 ) where t is the number of fault classes .
#Text=( 24 ) where P is the precision and R is the recall rate .
#Text=The information used to calculate these performance evaluation indicators is given by the confusion matrix .

#Text=The confusion matrix is also a way to measure the classifier ’s performance , and its form is as follows : ( 25 ) where represents the percentage of cases where fault i classified as fault j by classifier k .
#Text=c is the number of base classifiers , and t is the number of fault classes .
#Text=3.3. Formatting of Mathematical Components
#Text=Voting is a simple and practical decision-making fusion strategy , but its fusion results are often unreasonable because it ignores the performance differences of various methods .
#Text=In the process of fusion , the method with excellent performance should have greater/more influence on the voting results .
#Text=This paper proposes a validity concept based on the confusion matrix to improve the voting method .
#Text=The concept of the validity value is defined as follows : ( 26 ) where represents the validity of classifier k for fault j .
#Text=The larger the value of , the higher the credibility of the result when a test sample is classified as fault j by classifier k .
#Text=Additionally , the following conditions should be met : ( 27 )
#Text=In the improved voting method , the voting result is determined by the validity value of the base classifier for different faults .

#Text=Different from the conventional voting method , the fusion results given by the improved voting method are no longer crisp ( i.e. , either 0 or 1 ) , but they take values in the interval of 0 – 1 .

#Text=This not only avoids the shortcomings of the original voting method , which does not consider the difference in performance of each classifier on different faults , but also enhances the impact of the classifiers with good performance in terms of voting results .
#Text=A validity matrix can be obtained by using the improved voting method : ( 28 )
#Text=Combined with the combined weights , the decision of the fusion system is : ( 29 )
#Text=Finally , the maximum value is used as the fusion decision : ( 30 )

#Text=In summary , the proposed decision fusion system uses multiple performance evaluation indicators to measure the performance of the base classifier and determine the combined weights based on AHP and EW-TOPSIS for the base classifiers under these indicators .
#Text=In addition , an improved voting method based on validity was developed to improve the effectiveness of decision fusion .
#Text=In the next section , the proposed method is verified by the TE process .
